results.title: Touch the Sun: Top enders
results.creator_credit: Michael Aitkens, Jackie McKimmie, Jill Robb and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Alice, a runaway from home, meets on the road Mick, a boy in pursuit of his uncle. Stealing a car they traverse a treacherous stretch of desert road. When the car runs out of petrol they set out on foot only to become lost. With the harsh desert conditions threatening their survival Alice and Mick reflect on their actions and the families they have fled from. Cast includes John Jarratt, Madeleine Blackwell, Bennendine Woods, Donald Dale.

results.title: Touch the Sun: Devil's Hill
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Jill Robb, Revcom Television, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Sam and his sisters come to stay on their cousin’s remote farm in Tasmania. Badge, the farm boy, feels daunted by the arrival of his arrogant city cousins. After a huge violent storm, the prize cow escapes. The children decide to search the mountainous wilderness for the cow and their route leads up to the mysterious Devil’s Hill. The adventure teaches them they must stick together to survive. Based on the novel by Nan Chauncy.
Cast includes Peter Hehir, Mary Haire, John Flaus, Alexander Jacobs, Emma Pugh, Cameron Atkins and Jane McArthur.

results.title: Touch the Sun: Captain Johnno
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Johnno is 10 years of age, deaf and always in strife. He lives in a small fishing town and he has an affinity with the sea that he shares with Tony, an Italian fisherman, whom the townsfolk also ridicule. Johnno’s best friend is his sister, Julie, who is going away to boarding school in the city. When Johnno discovers this news he is devastated and runs away to his secret place - a deserted island. Johnno’s running away causes much havoc in the small community and the experience helps him realise that he must learn to live with his deafness and trust those who love him.

results.title: Touch the Sun: Peter and Pompey
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, Margot McDonald and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Peter, Margaret and Wayne discover a Roman boat in a cave that contains the manuscript of young Pompey. The discovery changes the tiny little town of Gamma into a brash, hyped-up tourist centre. The children also find that their lives change too - and they don’t like what is happening. The manuscript found in the boat reveals that the boat is cursed and, until the boat is destroyed it will continue to curse anyone who comes into contact with it. The children decide that in order to save Gamma they must finally carry out the drastic act of destroying the boat.

results.title: Touch the Sun : Princess Kate
results.creator_credit: George Ogilvie and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Thirteen year old Kate’s world is turned topsy turvy when she learns she is adopted. Unaware of the pain she is causing her adoptive family, Kate searches for her “real” parents. Her unexpected arrival on the doorstep of her natural mother stirs up mixed emotions. Kate succeeds in befriending her half-sister May before returning home to her adoptive parents with a new understanding of herself and her relationships. Rated: G

results.title: Circus
results.brief_description: Documentary about life on the road with the Swiss Circus Royale as it tours outback Australia. Intercuts performance scenes with shots of the less glamorous aspects of circus life. Suitable for secondary school level.
results.description: Documentary about life on the road with the Swiss Circus Royale as it tours outback Australia. Intercuts performance scenes with shots of the less glamorous aspects of circus life. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: We call it paradise
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence
results.brief_description: Niree Creed presents this portrait of Garden Island, 6 km. south of Perth and the effect the construction of HMAS Stirling, a naval base, has had on the island and on the town of Rockingham. The construction of the base caused some controversy as squatters, who had lived there for many years, were removed in the process. This film, produced by Defence Public Relations emphasises the benefits the base has brought to the local community.

results.title: Tor Schwanck: gold and silversmith
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon, Nina Syme and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”
Metal-work has been in Tor Schwanck’s family since the 15th century. He is an artisan trained in all aspects of metal-work. Schwanck uses non-precious metals as well as gold and silver. All the designs are originals, and he tours, exhibits and receives commissions for his work.

results.title: Be smart... don't start
results.brief_description: Especially designed for elementary grades at school, this film looks at cigarette smoking and the hazards of starting the habit. It presents opposing opinions and claims of cigarette manufacturers and medical men in an effort to create a lifetime mental attitude toward smoking at this critical age level.

results.title: River of my Life
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Amira Sabanovic
results.brief_description: A digital story made as part of the ‘Diversity @ Work’ Program in association with AMES, Australia Post and SBS. Amira describes the course her life has taken - from the ravages of War in her homeland through to the hardships of a refugee’s life in both Europe and Australia before finding acceptance and fulfillment through a supportive workplace.
